<Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="208" y="36" /> <mxPoint x="1057" y="36" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="a0u-BezgUWZ5qajZxbUA-0" value="<u>GOAL:</u><br><br><span>We have to provide a split between Data plan (data managed by the Gateway)&nbsp; and the Control plan (data managed by the mApi). The purpose of this split is to remove the CP as a SPOF if we deploy the GW in different DataCenter (DC) each DC owning specific domains. In addition of the SPOF aspect, we also avoir network latency if a DC is deployed in another region. We also avoid a global outage, so if a GW DC is down, other region/DC remain active.</span>" value="Purpose of this first step is to move repositories interfaces which are used by the GW but not by the MAPI under the DP scope.<br>This migration step is easy and do not require data migration as those repositories contains ephemeral data.<br>In addition, Groups and Roles will be mount in-memory by the GW using the sync process.<br><br><br>This very first step help to reduce the interactions between GW and the CP.<br><br><br>NOTE: after this step, user profile and underlying records (credentials, devices, linked identities...) are still owned by the CP so user authentication remains impossible without CP access. Only client_credential flow can be managed without CP.<br><br><br>complexity / effort: low" value="This second step is introducing Redis in the DP scope and we change the way to generate the user internalId (a.k.a sub claim).<br><br><span style="font-weight: normal">The internalId will become a concat of the IDP sourceId and the user externalId (internalId of the user within the IDP). This help to have a predictable sub value for all users which remains uniq into AM users collection. To reduce pressure on DP, some ephemeral repositories can be managed with Redis.</span><br><br>Also, during the authentication flow, Redis will be used as a cache to perstis the user profiles.<br><ul><li><span style="font-weight: normal">If the </span>user never connect to AM<span style="font-weight: normal">, then after the IDP authentication, if the </span>CP is accessible<span style="font-weight: normal"> the user profile is created and store into the cache.&nbsp;</span></li><li><span><span style="font-weight: normal">If the </span>user never connect to AM,<span style="font-weight: normal"> then after the IDP authentication, if the </span>CP is unreachable<span style="font-weight: normal"> the user profile is created only into the cache (without MFA or WebAuthn) the authentication can continue as scope approval are manage by the DP. If the app is configured to use MFA or WebAuthn, the authentication can continue but the MFA/WebAuthn information will be lost so when the user will connect later when the CP will be UP&amp;Running, he will have to enroll factor and credentials once again.&nbsp;</span></span></li><li><span style="font-weight: normal">If the </span>user already exist into the CP<span style="font-weight: normal"> and is </span>present into the cache<span style="font-weight: normal">, authentication can be done (including MFA eclusing FIDO2 and webauthn) even if the CP is unreachable</span></li></ul><div>complexity / effort: medium</div>" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;align=left;fontStyle=1;fillColor=#f5f5f5;fontColor=#333333;strokeColor=#666666;" vertex="1" value="The third step introduce a new plugin to provide a dedicated storage to the user information. In the same way as&nbsp; we have IDP plugins which allow to access user information in dedicated DB, this Domain information plugin will allow us to target a DB for each domain and will use dedicated collection for each domain. This plugin will manage the following collections:<br><ul><li>users</li><li>credentials</li><li>groups</li><li>devices</li><li>...</li></ul>Thanks to this plugin, the DP becomes fully autonomous once the sync has been done. Information created prior to this plugin introduction will have to be migrate from the CP the Domain data storage.&nbsp;<br>Drawback: User data become unmanageable as the GW will only manage the storage through this plugin (which will target the DP or another DB)<br><br>Challenges: <br><ul><li>provide a way to reuse connection accross plugin instances if they target the same DB.&nbsp;</li><li>how to manage upgrader as currently DB upgrades are manage by the mAPI</li></ul>complexity / effort: high" GW are used as bridge to preform DB access.&nbsp;</span></div><div><span><br></span></div><div><div>Cons<span style="font-weight: 400">: Network latency may slow down the Console usage and degrade place a sync process between DP &amp; CP which may lead to data inconsistency</span></li><li><span style="font-weight: 400">Network rules not required to expose DP on value="<div><div>With this final step we&nbsp;limit the gateway dependency to the CP database and align with apim behaviour when an update is done on a domain or an application (deploy banner will pop up and the GW will be aware of the change only the deployment is explicitly asked)<br><br></div><div><ul><li>This step requires first to rewrite the sync process to deploy a domain, applications, ..., as a single unit (deploy banner)</li></ul></div><div><ul><li>A second step dependent of the previous one will be to put a distributed sync process to allow the gateway to sync from a Redis in case of CP database failure</li></ul><div><br></div></div><div>With this step the GW can scale without CP</div></div><div><br></div><div><br></div><div><br></div><div>complexity / effort: high<br></div>"
